title: I don't know if Rito can make cool champs like Aurellion Sol....
body:
When everybody and their grandma has a dash, two gap closers, and a dog whistle. 

Which is a shame because I really like the idea of him, but between the casting delay on his Q, and him essentially losing his passive once people get into "zed range", I feel like I'm never gonna have an occasion to pick him. 

I mean I guess if the enemy team doesn't have a zed/leblanc/talon/yasuo/focus sash rattata you could safely pick him.

But I can't tell you the last time I had a game that didn't have a zed, yasuo, or leblanc in it.

i've already witnessed both personally and on various streams that if you keep that balance of having enemies just far enough to where they can't hurt you decently but just close enough to be tearing them to pieces with your stars, he's actually a complete monster. if he really gets into a sticky situation he can shut it down almost completely with an R-Q combo and walk out or continue DPS with stars.

He is poorly designed. He is equivalently  singed/taric. The main reason that he won't be a strong pick in his current state is due to 2 critical facts: 

1. He cannot hide in bushes. He MUST use fog of war to get surprise flanks/ambushes off which also means either you need good vision control of an area (meaning clearing out enemy wards) or the enemy has to have poor vision control.

2. His damage output is pretty bad considering his passive can be shutdown if hes cc'd which is extremely likely to happen in the current meta of champions.

I don't know what to say except that whoever designed him had the season 1/2 mindset.
Well he was Ao Shin...
